str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From echos; to make a loud noise, i.e. Reverberate.
Perhaps from chalao through the idea of hollowing out as a vessel; copper.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: From alale; to vociferate, i.e. to wail; figuratively, to clang.
A cymbal. From a derivative of the base of kuma; a 'cymbal'.
